reviewText:
The video to DVD quality of this makes it look grainy, like it was patched together by somebody using a Dell computer from 1997.
Also, the introductions to each performance are missing, and this lapse amounts to butchery when it comes to Jon Voight's Dylan intro...which is cut entirely.

Performers look TOO WIDE and like they weigh 500 pounds each!!
Horrible copy of what was a great 'Johnny Cash Tribute' TV Show

Really disappointed that this was not the whole concert, no Maverick singing etc.
JC songs all good and performers were good

song number seven was suppose to be Man In Black and it was some song that I did not know what the singer was saying ,and some songs where not on it that was on the original , Love Johnny  hate the dvd.
parts of the original concert were left off of the DVD

I recall watching this show when it was on PBS around 15 years ago. In this DVD you get only secondary recordings of the video and none of the commentary which actually made the overall show more interesting back in the day.  I would give it fewer stars if it wasn't Johnny Cash

I saw this tribute on television when it first aired. For the longest time I have been looking for a DVD of the tribute. This isn't exactly what I saw on tv - it's only the performances, none of the announcing or talking about Johnny, but it's good enough. And it's exactly what my father wanted (he and I watched the show together) - he didn't want all the talking. So he loves it. So much that he's bought more and gives them to friends.

The video quality is among the worst I have ever seen. It looked like it had been copied over and over again. In addition, portions of the special had been deleted. I would NOT waste my money on this DVD.A Tribute To Johnny Cash

I was really excited to find this on DVD. That excitement ended when I viewed the disc. My VHS copy I made from the original TV airing is better quality.  Sure some of the songs are missing, but it views but better, and all the intros are included.
